title: Creating an Inequality
text: We must first create an inequality to represent Tiffany's salary with respect to her total number of sales, n.

title: Creating an Inequality
text: We know that $20,000 plus 2 percent (or 0.02) of Tiffany's sales must be at least $100,000. This means that $$20000+0.02n \geq 100000$$, where n is the total number of Tiffany's sales.

title: Solving the Inequality
text: To solve this inequality, we need to isolate the variable n.

title: Solving the Inequality
text: To start, we can subtract 20,000 from both sides of the inequality. We now have $$0.02n \geq 80000$$.

title: Solving the Inequality
text: We now need to divide both sides of the inequality by 0.02. This means that $$n \geq 4000000$$.

title: Creating a Sentence-Answer
text: Since we know that n, Tiffany's total sales, must be greater than or equal to 4000000, what is the minimum sale she has to make?
